group.groupDescription: SQL Server 2008 Setup configuration checks for rules group 'GlobalRules'

RunRuleResult.description: Checks whether the computer meets minimum operating system version requirements.
RunRuleResult.message: The operating system version meets the minimum requirements for this product.

RunRuleResult.description: Checks whether the account running SQL Server Setup has administrator rights on the computer.
RunRuleResult.message: The account running SQL Server Setup has administator rights on the computer.

RunRuleResult.description: Checks if a pending computer restart is required. A pending restart can cause Setup to fail.
RunRuleResult.message: The computer does not require a restart.

RunRuleResult.description: Checks whether the WMI service is started and running on the computer.
RunRuleResult.message: The Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) service is running.

RunRuleResult.description: Checks if the SQL Server registry keys are consistent.
RunRuleResult.message: SQL Server registry keys are consistent and can support SQL Server installation or upgrade.

RunRuleResult.description: Checks whether the SQL Server installation media is too long.
RunRuleResult.message: The SQL Server installation media is not too long.

group.groupDescription: SQL Server 2008 Setup configuration checks for rules group 'InstallGlobalRules'

RunRuleResult.description: Checks if a computer restart is required because of broken fusion ATL. A pending restart can cause SQL Server Setup to fail.
RunRuleResult.message: The computer does not require a restart.

RunRuleResult.description: Checks whether SQL Server 7.0 or SQL Server 7.0 OLAP Services is installed. Server Server 2008 is not supported with SQL Server 7.0.
RunRuleResult.message: SQL Server 7.0 or SQL Server 7.0 OLAP Services is not installed.

RunRuleResult.description: Checks if existing performance counter registry hive is consistent.
RunRuleResult.message: The performance counter registry hive is consistent.

RunRuleResult.description: Checks for previous releases of SQL Server 2008 Business Intelligence Development Studio
RunRuleResult.message: Previous releases of SQL Server 2008 Business Intelligence Development Studio are not installed.

RunRuleResult.description: Checks whether there is an existing SQL Server 2008 CTP installation.
RunRuleResult.message: There are no previous CTP installations of SQL Server 2008.

RunRuleResult.description: Checks if the SQL Server registry keys are consistent.
RunRuleResult.message: SQL Server registry keys are consistent and can support SQL Server installation or upgrade.

RunRuleResult.description: Checks whether the computer is a domain controller. Installing SQL Server 2008 on a domain controller is not recommended.
RunRuleResult.message: This computer is not a domain controller.

RunRuleResult.description: Verifies that the computer is connected to the Internet. When a Microsoft .NET application like Microsoft Management Studio starts, there maybe be a slight delay while the .NET security check validates a certificate.
RunRuleResult.message: The computer is connected to the Internet and .NET security checks can be completed.

RunRuleResult.description: Determines whether SQL Server Setup is supported on this operating system platform.
RunRuleResult.message: SQL Server Setup is supported on this operating system platform.

RunRuleResult.description: Checks whether Windows PowerShell is installed. Windows PowerShell is a pre-requisite of Microsoft SQL Server 2008 Express with Advanced Services.
RunRuleResult.message: Windows PowerShell is installed or not required.

RunRuleResult.description: Checks whether the Windows Firewall is enabled.
RunRuleResult.message: The Windows Firewall is enabled. Make sure the appropriate ports are open to enable remote access. See the rules documentation at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=94001 for information about ports to open for each feature.
